review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2026
review-text: good performance, camera, and productivity, great condition, but not a very good battery life

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2026
review-text: Seems to be ok. Water stains inside the lens cover. Doesn't seem to make pictures wonky. Shadow around front facing camera but doesn't seem to mess up image on camera.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2025
review-text: -1 star for poor packaging. The phone was protected in bubble wrap and turned on and worked fine, but the box itself was just paper. -1 star damages to back and camera (Good condition). Everything works and I don't intend to put more scratches as I have a case on the phone, but it was definitely more than expected. +1 star for pre-installed screen protector. It's one of those film screen protectors and I will replace it because I prefer tempered glass, but it's definitely a nice touch and better than nothing for coming out of the box. Set up was super easy and so far connectivity has been perfect.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2025
review-text: The phone is beautiful and looks great, in pristine condition. The only problem I have is why would the seller send a junk charger and charging cord ? The cord will damage the phone because it doesn‚Äôt fit correctly . I had to get the correct charging cord to get it working .  I had to use my iPhone fat charger to get it working fine after.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2025
review-text: The first phone I received from this seller appeared to be in excellent condition, but it turned out to have a serious problem, that I'm now learning is very common. The phone would work great on WiFi, but would STRUGGLE to maintain service anywhere outside of my house. I would have service about 1/10th of the time, and could NEVER get through a phone call without it dropping, when I could even get through. Although they should have caught this, I can't fully blame the seller (which is why I gave 3 stars for a basically useless phone... which otherwise would be awesome... ya know, if it worked) because this is the 4th phone (3 - S22 Ultra's, 1 - Note 20 Ultra) I've had the exact same issue with over the last 2 years. I ordered a temporary phone to get me through while I return this one and wait for a replacement, so I'll update when I receive the next one... UPDATE: I'm raising my rating to 4 stars. The second phone arrived yesterday and so far it seems to be excellent. If any issues arise with the new phone I'll be sure to come back, but I'm hoping this is the last S22 I'll ever order...

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2026
Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024
review-text: Well it‚Äôs written that it‚Äôs unlocked but it wasn‚Äôt. I contacted them and they answered 2-3 days if I remember it correctly. Luckily they gave me the NETWORK PIN CODE. So just to be sure that YOU CONTACT AND ASK THEM FOR IT. But for the value for money, this is WORTH IT! Yes it had some scratches here and there but I don‚Äôt mind. It‚Äôs just in the sides and bottom of the phone anyway, and I use case so it doesn‚Äôt bother me that much. I bought this phone to have another ANDROID phone since I have more faith in android than iPhone (sorry fans), because for me it does more, and I can do more in android. So coming from iPhone mini 12, to S22U, it‚Äôs not that easy in size difference. But the phone itself is easy to use. it comes with cord and CHARGER BRICK! It's C to C charger as well! Thank you for that, I got the fast charger out of the box!! I can‚Äôt say about durability because from what I know, the phone that has been opened or ‚Äúrenewed‚Äù is not as durable as the new one especially when it comes to WATER RESISTANCE. But other than that, I guess this is STILL AN AWESOME SAMSUNG PHONE FOR 2024. Been using it since July. So I can really say it's a good buy. Edit: Sept 2025 now. My phone fell not from so high, usually from my sling bag or from my hand when my nephew's accidentally bump in to me, it got crack on its back. Buuuut still works great. How I deal with it? My case is usually clear since then, because I want to show color or photos behind my phone. So the solution? UPGRADE.... just the color though! Phone works fine so why change?! Hahahaha! Just get a skin! In a span of a year, I made my black phone to BLUE and MINT (GREEN). Currently mint green as of now. üòÅ

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2025
review-text: It's a legit and an original S22 Ultra and it's working properly. I check the IMEI and serial number and it does have it, but I'm a tad bit disappointed that the old "wear and tear" is noticeable in terms of the color of the phone on all sides. That's the downside of buying refurbished phones, I guess, but other than that it's pretty good for its price.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2025
review-text: I know it's refurbished. The back cover is a replacement. The screen and frames are no problem. I only had one issue: the SIM card holder arrived damaged and was deformed due to high temperatures. This causes problems inserting the SIM card, and it constantly disconnects. The good thing is that it's sold, and I'm going to buy it. But I do recommend the seller.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2025
review-text: Everything works as it should. Did have chipped paint at the too front of the phone. Not in excellent condition.
